work.name: New York University Libraries
highlights: Provide reference services and teach original workshops for computational research methods, project design, and tools including publishing platforms, integrated development environments, and linked databases

Conduct outreach for Digital Scholarship Services among subject librarians and faculty at NYU

highlights: Edited entry quality, spelling, grammar, and formatting consistency for 4,300 headword bilingual scholarly dictionary accompanying a multivolume literary work
Managed and performed data entry for Microsoft Excel lexicon of headwords including reference numbers, sense definitions, parts of speech, contextual labels, and quotations

work.name: The University of Chicago Library, Preservation
work.position: Mary and Samuel Somit Preservation Metadata Intern
highlights: Developed a metadata application profile and designed workflows for metadata enhancement of the Hanna Papanek Photograph Collection for publication on the UChicago Node platforms

Evaluated inventories of digitized photographs to prescribe reparative metadata enhancement in collaboration with UChicago’s Metadata Analyst Librarian, Southern Asian Studies Librarian, Preservation Department, Digital Library Development Center, and Digital Strategies and Services Division
Established key points of collaboration and workflow integration between the University of Chicago Library and the Online Cultural and Historical Research Environment (OCHRE) graph database system

work.name: The University of Chicago Library, Digitization
highlights: Handled and digitized texts from the University of Chicago's Special Collections including scanning materials, recording metadata, and performing quality control of digital copies
Designed and implemented digitization workflows for use by Special Collections and the Digitization Unit
Organized digital files and executed Optical Character Recognition (OCR) processes on digitized materials

work.name: The Siam Society and Southeast Asian Cultural Heritage Alliance
highlights: Organized a conference held by the Southeast Asian Cultural Heritage Alliance (SEACHA) in January 2023 on Climate Change and Cultural Heritage in Southeast Asia
Coordinated members of SEACHA, sponsors, the Siam Society’s member volunteers, youth participants, civic society leaders, and academics from ten ASEAN nations
Organized a capacity-building workshop for Southeast Asian youth in August 2022 exploring the intersections of culture and climate action alongside effective multimedia communication
